website_summaries.verdict: A good value on a scale that performs very well measuring very small weights.
pros: Tare function makes it easy to use with a tray
cons: This scale has a low upper limit of 20 grams

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend. Scale does not give repeatable readings even after ...
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. Scale does not give repeatable readings even after calibration. Was using it on a stable granite surface, no drafts or vibrations. Can load a 10 g cal weight (read approx 10 g) then add the 2nd 10 g cal weight (reads approx 20 g +/- 1%). Take off the 2nd weight and 1st weight reads 9.5 g (?!). Add the 2nd weight back on reads (roughly 18 g). Massive drift when weighing 100-200 mg samples. Constantly need to tare (ie between every single sample).
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Not milligram accurate but good price and very convenient
customer_reviews.text: The last digit of precision is pure noise, so no this is not milligram accurate. It also has a tendency to drift such that the longer an item sits on the scale the heavier it gets for about a minute. I kept the scale because it's a good price and it's very convenient for measuring small amounts after it's warmed up for a few minutes. Other scales have to have a minimum weight before they start measuring so if your okay with that stick with a 0.01g accurate scale.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Anderson

customer_reviews.title: A very small scale.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a college lab course. Tweezers are worthless, and the scale plate came unglued during shipment. Once reseated back onto the scale, I verified results with the sample weights included with the scale. For the tiny weights used specifically for my course, the scale works very well. Don't plan on weighing anything larger than a watch face, or anything heavier than a 9V battery.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Hostetler

customer_reviews.title: Decent price, might be missing parts
customer_reviews.text: My scale didn't arrive in original packaging like other reviewers. That's okay because packaging can be excessive with products. However, it sends that it isn't new...like it should have been a warehouse deal, except I bought it brand new. Add that it's missing one of the calibration weights (even after scouring the box to see if it moved around) and I think I was sent a returned, possibly used, product. It's still a decent deal, and would've been 5 stars if it contained all parts. As it didn't, I couldn't overlook the rest. Mahalo.
customer_reviews.author: Polyglot Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Display doesn’t work - poor quality for the price paid.
customer_reviews.text: Received a defective unit. See photo. The digital numbers are not displaying correctly on the screen. This product was $8 to $10 more than others on amazon. I would have expected the quality to reflect the price. It is an I convenience to have to send it back. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great for measuring medications!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of scale! We have use the same one, from the same product line, for eight years for measuring a loved one’s medications. This scale measures to the thousandth of a gram, which we require on a regular basis. In my experience, this is a feature not commonly found in digital scales. We just bought a second one, since we are afraid our old one will soon fail (after all of these years), and we want to make sure that we can get this very same one as our replacement. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Nice scale
customer_reviews.text: Much more durable, much more accurate it seems then the fragile but identical looking "American Weigh/" Better design, better tray, They weigh the newest pennies 2.499 to 2.5 to 2.495 grams, give or take a few mg for some grime they seem accurate =- 5mg. I need to ultrasonically clean some pennies and then weigh them, see how close it can get em!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Rose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what it was needed for!
customer_reviews.text: Scare arrived on time and in perfect condition. I needed it to measure out beads in a prescription that I was trying to tapper off of safely. It worked wonderfully. I only have to measure out the beads every 2 to 3 weeks so the nice box it comes it made it easy to store the scale with all its accessories without risking damage or losing it. Definitely glad I purchased this particular scale. It is amazing that it was so cheap and be so reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Okay scale. The pan is smaller than I expected, and mine only came with one weight when the picture shows two. It tends to walk up and down a bit if you let it sit for more than a couple seconds. Replace the batteries often, if they're more than a couple weeks old and used the consistency is, well there's no consistency, and you constantly have to recalibrate and rezero. I've noticed I'll calibrate with the included 10g weight, then weigh the weight after and it's +/- about .005g. But it's decent for the price, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Collin P.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great scale
customer_reviews.text: Great for fine measuring. I homebrew and need to get accurate measurements of brewing salts for building my water profile. Most standard scales aren't sensitive enough to satisfy my needs and this scale perfectly measures down to 0.001 grams. I love it. I wish it could measure higher amounts as well as small; I tried measuring 12 g and it overloaded the scale.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Brown Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Useless for smaller weights
customer_reviews.text: This scale is junk if you’re trying to measure things at the low end of the advertised weight; it will not register any weight until the .004, meaning it’s useless to measure the supplements I bought it for. Not only that but it constantly jumps off weight- it can be on a sturdy surface, with nothing on it and no wind and the reading will be off and different everytime. I wouldn’t trust it as far as I could throw it. The only way I would recommend this is if you don’t need one that’s accurate, easy to use and don’t mind overpaying.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: I really like it!
customer_reviews.text: To me, this is a beautiful device for weighing small amounts, combining good appearance with good functionality. It feels good to use. I like how the lid opens and closes, although not strictly necessary for weighing, at least protects the platform. I like the tare weight sitting in its little home base, ready to serve its function of calibrating the device. I like the price, pretty reasonable. I like the buttons. I like the little metal tray. I guess I like everything about this little device!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Smallest scale I've ever seen, but seems precise and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This scale is tiny, I guess I didn't notice the dimensions which are about 4" x 3". But that's ok, this little guy seems both precise and accurate. I can repeatedly put the same item on the scale and it reproduces the same weight. I was interested in the low end measuring things less than a gram, it seems to be accurate in this range.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great scale for a great price
customer_reviews.text: If you need to measure any small amount and be precise, I recommend this product. I have used it to weigh out powders that must be accurate in small quantities, and I even used it to get a pine wood derby to the exact weight. It is very easy to use (as long as you read the instructions) and I have used it several times prior to writing the review.
customer_reviews.author: Micalle

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After 2 Hours
customer_reviews.text: This device was great for 2 hours, and then it stopped working. I am not sure if I received a defective unit or something, but when I try to use it, it just displays the calibration screen. I can try to re-calibrate, but nothing happens. All I can do is turn it off and on. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S

customer_reviews.title: DONT USE FOR GEMS!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on using this for a gem it will not be precise! We performed a calibration upon receiving the item to make sure it was accurate. We then placed a gem weighed by a lab on the scale and the reading was way off. The gem weighed .66CT and the scale was swaying between .63-.68ct that is a big difference when it comes to diamonds. The readings never did stabilize. We followed instructions and located in an area no other electronic equipment and closed the cover while weighing. May be fine for grams but definitely not a diamond scale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't begin to say how thrilled I am with this scale.
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago, I paid about the same price for a scale that's 1/10th as sensitive (100 X 0.01 g). It works, but I always wanted something more precise for quantifying my gem collection. I thought I'd have to shell out a couple hundred bucks for a good precision scale...until I found this one. This has both the sensitivity of a high-end machine and the easy portability of my other scale. Also, it and its box are much more solidly-built than my other scale. Definitely the best $20 I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: dagnirath

customer_reviews.title: Was almost in disbelief.....
customer_reviews.text: That the scale that arrived was spot on accurate. I was half expecting at such a low price that it would be poorly made since lately that has been my experience. I threw a silver dollar on the scale, and verified that it was correct. Technically, it was 0.001 grams off, but that seemed like an acceptable margin of error for a laymen like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Austin mcmaho

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this jewelers scale for about a month, and basically I'm impressed. The build quality is good. Seems like a very well designed scale. I'm weighing items in the range of 80-150mg and the accuracy seems to be excellent, Stability seems to be very good as well as repeatability. Chinese manufactures don't always produce impressive products, but to my surprise, this time they got it right.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend. This is my 2nd scale in 4 months and both did the same thing with very minimal use. ( 2xs in one week and its jumpy) Once you hit Tare, the scale numbers jump all around and don't stay at zero. When you need a precise measurement, this doesn't cut it. It calibrates fine, I've tried multiple batteries and now I must find a more reliable brand. Our Doctor's office uses this exact one and it lasts months. No clue why both of mine have lasted less than 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine44

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to weigh out 5 to 10 mg for doing DNA extraction. Did not want to spend a bundle of money. It works great but turns itself off a bit too quickly and the display is a bit hard to read. I can easily live with it and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve SB

customer_reviews.title: Auto-shutoff is too fast
customer_reviews.text: It's good in all aspects EXCEPT that the auto-shutoff is too fast and I cant find any way to stop it. I can't tare a container, fill it and get it back on the scale before it shuts down and loses the tare weight! I'd turn off that feature but can't find any instructions for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Platform - Not Ideal for Weighing Powders
customer_reviews.text: I use this scale for precision weighing of salts and gelling agents for cooking. This scale works great for measuring small amounts, e.g. 2 or 3 grams. It's very fast, very accurate, and easy to use. (And also, makes the user feel like a drug dealer. Or is that just me?) Unfortunately the platform is incredibly small and I can't weigh more than maybe 4 grams of any ingredient in one go. I'm not sure if the density of the average gem is such that this is a nonissue, and since that is what the scale is designed for it's tough to fault it. But still, it's super annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Adam MachanicTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Accurate to a few thousandths of a millimeter
customer_reviews.text: Of course it has a rolling average, but any deadzone/threshold for small amounts didn't show when weighing a fortune from a cookie, and it went back to 0.000 afterward. Didn't need to self calibrate as it was factory calibrated and the two included 10g weights were 10.000 and 19.999 without hitting TARE for the first time. Came with batteries (just pull the plastic tab out). Treat this one nice (don't mash it, twist it, drop/shock it, etc.) and it will do what you want at extreme accuracy (0.01mg hyper-accurately). Also learn how to use it properly. It's a tool, and a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.

customer_reviews.title: Lacks accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: This scale's zero point has drifted for me as little as a quarter grain and as much as 3 grains and so I cannot trust it. Save yourself the trouble and pay for better quality. Measuring things at such precession, deserve better accuracy than what this product can provide.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Could have bought a larger scale, with the this smaller one inaccuracies.
customer_reviews.text: This scale includes a 10 gram weight that can be used to determine the scales accuracy. Unfortunately mine was determined to be off by a fraction of a gram, however there is no way reset the scale to original accuracy. So with each measurement I have to add and or subtract 0.138th of a gram.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Very precise little scale
customer_reviews.text: For weights above ~20mg this device is crazy accurate. I think static charge on the plastic lid exerts pressure on the plate because weights go up about 10mg when the lid is closed, so I just leave it open and use it in a room with calm air. Only complaint is you have to weigh things quickly because the scale turns itself off after 1 minute of idle.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: How accurately can your eye measure 20 milligrams of anything?
customer_reviews.text: Pills for pets are expensive (or don't exist for some meds), so my vet writes scrips for people-sized generics which are cheap and easily available. Still a tedious chore, but now I can be certain the fragment I just cut off a tablet is close to the desired dose. Just be aware, most pills have a lot more 'fillers' than drugs -- a tablet may weigh 200 milligrams but perhaps 1/10 of that is the medication. Break off a 20 milligram piece and you have a 2mg dose for your critter.
customer_reviews.author: BB333

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying if you reload.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it 4 stars but after several months of using scale stopped staying on long enough as needed to check powder charges I was trickling. Yes I replaced the battery. I have checked it against my beam scale and it is always on the money so if you are weighing charges it will work but beware when it shuts off you will have to stop and recal when you power back up or it will be out about .01 grains to .05 grains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: We are rather disappointed in the scale only in the fact that the 4 padded legs on the bottom are NOT level so no matter where or what surface we place it on, it rocks. Any scale will read incorrectly if its not balanced & one that goes down to milligrams is even more sensitive to any fluctuation. The only way to use at least this particular scale, is to place something under 1 "leg"...afterwards it seems to work just fine. I considered returning it but figured I can just deal with "propping" it up....after all, the cost of this scale makes up for this lack of workmanship that SHOULD have been noticed BEFORE shipping it to any customer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Small scale not for Chemists
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use but not easy to clean. Don’t buy if you have to weight out light powdered substances light flour. Also the size is extremely small. Could fit in you back pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Zhivon Johnson

customer_reviews.title: a must for the gem lover
customer_reviews.text: over the years I have purchased many of these little scales this seems to be one of the better ones. Its heavy for the size and came well protected in its packaging. These scales seldom last long but for the cost I can deal with that, it calibrates easily, seems to be accurate (enough for my needs anyway) I like the ease of shifting through the various types of items it can weigh. I think it is a good value at this price, and if it lasts a reasonable time I would probably buy this style again.
customer_reviews.author: 2cat mom

customer_reviews.title: Smart Weigh GEM20 High Precision Digital Milligram Scale 20 x 0.001g Reloading, Jewelry and Gems Sca
customer_reviews.text: It's a good scale and the price is pretty good. I have been comparing it to two other scales and the numbers hold up between them so feeling it's keeping good enough accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This balance performs quite well. It has far better precision than I really need for weighing diet supplements. However, I did not realize when I ordered it how very tiny the balance actually is. With the balance pan being only 1 1/2 inches across, you can not use a very large weigh container. And with a limit of 20 grams you can not use a very heavy weigh container. Nevertheless, for weighing diet supplements in the 0.5 to 5 gram range, it is more than adequate, especially considering the price. And my wife likes the small size because it does not clutter the kitchen counter very much.
customer_reviews.author: William D Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Not as pictured. There is a tiny little pad to set the tray on and a pain. There is suppose to be a plate on the scale to set the tray. Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this scale
customer_reviews.text: After having a couple of low end scales, I am kicking myself for not getting this one in the first place. It was already calibrated but came with a weight if recalibration is needed. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Very good scale
customer_reviews.text: A very good scale with easy calibration. Includes tweezers, calibration weights, batteries and a small metal bowl, that's about the size of the weighing platform, molded with a flat handle and small pour spout. Max weight that can be measured without the metal bowl is 20 grams. 20 grams is max. Recieved product as pictured and it works great. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: tinfur

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little scale
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little scale. Has it's own box with a magnetic lid. The precision of measurement we are able to attain now is incredible. Exactly as described with the added bonus of an awesome box to keep it new. The unit itself has a very easy to follow instruction booklet that even shows you to to recalibrate it if needed. excellent product, great shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Burkhart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent “food” scale
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. As a “food” scale, it gives me the peace of mind that a reliably precise amount of substance is going into my body.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Luinstra

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a much better purchase than past scales. Of course, time will tell durability. So impressed it goes to .001 . I am impressed it comes with weights to calibrate. I have ordered these separately in the past (different product and seller) and waited weeks for them.
customer_reviews.author: Brennon G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Service
customer_reviews.text: Product digital read out failed after one use. Returned product and had substitute in one day ! Eveything seems to be fine. Good instrument for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit for my reloading press.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this scale for reloading and have found it to be quite nice. I use a medicine measuring cup that I place in the pan, and after I add powder to double check my load, I hit Tare and I am ready to go again. I like that it settles reasonably quickly with seemingly consistent results. I did have to recalibrate when I received it. My only gripe with the device is the small size of the sensor button. I have to use the rather small pan that comes with it as a base for my disposable medicine measuring cup so that I can easily pour in the powder from the shell I am checking.
customer_reviews.author: David Hill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for weighing things that are small amounts
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for weighing things that are small amounts. It is extremely accurate. Only issue I had was that it turned off quickly and then the tare when back to 0 when you restarted it. I was measuring small amounts of charcoal powder in the little tray it comes with and i kept having to dump it out on a surface, put the tray back on, then tare it again, and then weigh the powder again. Get's annoying when you are trying to take small amounts of the powder out of the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: everyone else, move out the weigh.
customer_reviews.text: this thing is accourate. and if it'd .014 inaccurate ( i can tell by the 10gram bullet wweight that comes with it to calibrate it). all i do, put my bulleton it, it registers as 10.014.i taaaakke it off it ssays 0, but thatsd wrong. i hit tade, which makes it true zero. not you can measure your anythings very easy. this is one of the only good inexpensive jewelry scales ive seen.
customer_reviews.author: G718 PRIME

customer_reviews.title: The automatic shutoff is too quick, needs to be longer, say about 5-10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: It works well as long as you close the cover and let the reading stabilize (air currents will spoil the accuracy). The automatic shut off is very inconvenient because it takes time to weigh out a quantity of powder or granular material. Need a longer period to accommodate weighing out a specific weight of material or a defeat switch to stop auto shutoff.
customer_reviews.author: William A. McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase and product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Comes with tray that can be tared, 2 weight checks, precision tweezers, storage case, and battery. Just like in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes trickle charging much easier by showing when you are getting close to the charge weight.
customer_reviews.author: 22Diva

customer_reviews.title: Good unit but small.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected but great if it suits your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: High quality very accurate scale...
customer_reviews.text: Need a high precision digital milligram scale? This is the one to get. Scale comes with tweezers, measuring cup with pour spout and calibration weight. Ready to use right out of the box. High quality very accurate scale.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Never could seen to get an accurate reading .. I did like the convenien m weighed for calibrating... but truthfully that's about all that I liked about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable good balance for the price. Great for dividing up prescription pills for controlled half or even quarter doses. Funny that 5mg, 10mg, or 20mg doses of drugs today cost the same price. So if you can get the 20mg pill and create 4 doses to save money. BUT you must be careful and you must know what you are doing and have good dexterity skills. But the balance can help keep the doses uniform.
customer_reviews.author: Karch Kiraly

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Good price, and very accurate, will need another with a higher capacity but for now it serves its purpose. Would also like if I did not have to keep the box, but the instructions and accessories must stay with the item for calibration.
customer_reviews.author: eugene f.

customer_reviews.title: Weighed 0.01g differences as accurately as $1k+ scales
customer_reviews.text: I compared this (weighing 0.02g- 0.5g salts) to two VWR ultra-high sensitivity 0.0001g scales and the weights on this scale were right in-between the two scientific scales. These data are consistent with the possibility that this scale is just as accurate and precise.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Great for reloading
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be accurate and repeatably so. I don't know if I'd trust it for super sensitive measurements as I wasn't able to compare it to known weights, but it's great for quick measurements when throwing powder for reloading. Not so good if you plan to trickle. I use it to make sure my charges are good, and I also use it to lot my bullets to make sure they're as close to each other as possible. I'm very happy with the product, the price, the size - everything.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Darm

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy scale
customer_reviews.text: I weight pigment powders for mixing colors. Even in small quantities this scale is very accurate To about 0.02 milligram. Sometimes more precise. I have owned another scale that has digits to 0.01 my but it is way off. I am very pleased with this purchase especially it came with 10 gram weight to calibrate or check as needed
customer_reviews.author: Thanh

customer_reviews.title: Maybe okay for some things
customer_reviews.text: Seems fairly accurate, but the little stainless steel cup is too small to measure spices in, and it's pain to keep it balanced with a different Cup on top of it. Wanted to use this to measure seasonings for baking and sausage making. Doesn't really work for that.
customer_reviews.author: Campfire218

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome for measuring the mass gem stones and precious minerals. Not exactly lab accuracy of course, but perfect for the backyard hobbiest!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to aid with tapering down Cymbalta. It works very well, but is a little finicky with the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, Calibrated and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Was completely calibrated when opened, batteries were at full charge. Has been reliable since I bought it a month and a half ago.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: millidud
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this scale is great, EXCEPT, the GEM20 will not properly weigh milligrams. After many calibrations and changes in the environment where conditions could affect the scale, 0.001 and above readings are all over the place and never the same twice. These errors are unacceptable when dealing with sensitive weights such as milligrams. A $20 milligram scale seemed too good to be true, and it was.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Decent little mg scale
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I use this to measure out small weights of actives for use in skincare product samples. This is especially good when I need to make just one sample and need to be precise about my measurements. I bought another scale by this company but it malfunctioned after one use, so not sure about the long term reliability of this brand. Great price though.
customer_reviews.author: tamarind25

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and Pricey
customer_reviews.text: Do not clean! Even if done carefully with a damp paper towel, it may break your scale entirely. Very flimsy Chinese product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Guy

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I am tapering down on a medication. I open caps and weigh out my next 2week dose. This scale is perfect and accurate
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Smart looking and works well
customer_reviews.text: I use this to measure gem weights. It works well and has batteries included. Clear display! Great unit!
customer_reviews.author: Parshman

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I use this to track the accurate amount of a certain medication. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job as expected and stated. Simple and clear to operate. We do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JoftheGingers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scale with consistent reliability
customer_reviews.text: Works great and perfect for reloading or other sciences where precise calculations down to the thousandth of a gram are required.
customer_reviews.author: SJH_Nomad_Tx

customer_reviews.title: Erratic
customer_reviews.text: I calibrate every time I use and it still gives me erratic readings. Fluctuating between 9.996-9.998. Never 10.000. Frustrating. Especially when I’m tapering off a med and need to be precise.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Blasko

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to measure out small milligram doses of my cat's medications.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I tried it out for my gems but it always ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried it out for my gems but it always showed a different result. I have the weight for certain gems already and tested to see if it was correct and it was way off. I returned. I imagine it might be ok for grams, but that was not why I purchased this item.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Ito

customer_reviews.title: dont read mg
customer_reviews.text: i got this to read mg like it claims it dont read mg
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this scale. It does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An unbeaten value for a sub 50mg range scale.
customer_reviews.text: The 5 stars are in context of a milligram scale for $18.00 US. It does take longer(5-10 seconds) to register and settle in the sub 50 mg range than would be ideal, but where are you going to find a consistent milligram scale at even 5x the cost?
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The scale is very easy to use. I am using it to weigh mg for a powder supplement for my dog. I got a very quick explanation from them on how to weigh mg. Thank you very much for your help. The scale is great.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Decent little scale
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little scale for measuring small amounts of something. Not quite scientific quality but pretty close and at a great price. There are some issues with the weight changing slightly from moment to moment but not by much just 2-3 thousands (.003). Overall it will serve its purpose well and did not break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Leland G. Whitlock

customer_reviews.title: Quite pleased with performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: This little scale works pretty well for me. The calibration weights are nice too. It doesn't handle heavy weight but does light weight pretty well. The display is easy to read and batteries last a long time. You do have be careful to not apply too much weight to the scale platform but this is a delicate instrument. That is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Turner

customer_reviews.title: This thing works GREAT !!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to reload ammo, and it's right on the money.
customer_reviews.author: Brad G

customer_reviews.title: Good price and good service but weight limit and small ...
customer_reviews.text: Good price and good service but weight limit and small weigh pan leave this item useful for only small items like rings, earrings and small bracelets. Not great for necklaces
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good accuracy but the scale broke in less than a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good accuracy but the scale broke in less than a month and I barely use it. Hopefully he will send me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exquisite!
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality, extremely accurate jewelry scale capable of weighing 0.005 grams!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: These are very accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I like the accuracy of them and how easy they are to use. I wish they had different colors. Weighing oz of ingredients in the kitchen for baking. Gave them away to my friends i took a cooking class with they had these in the class we took. My husband wants some too for him and his friends for weighing the black powder for black powder musket shooting!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: No tweezers
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the description here and on the box it came in, no tweezers were included. Not that big of a deal since it's the scale I was interested in, but none the less, it annoys me when you don't receive what you are supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Richards

customer_reviews.title: Not always consistent but close enough for my needs and reflects the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not always consistent but close enough for my needs and reflects the price.
customer_reviews.author: BeckCo

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend using this if you need precise measurements in the single-digits of milligrams, acted a little "squirrely" even after re-calibrating it.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lake

customer_reviews.title: Good product good price.
customer_reviews.text: So far the product has worked very well. Unfortunately I do not have a second scale to test its accuracy so I will rely on the manufacturer. It does seem to be quite sensitive and again it has worked very well for me. At this time I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for measuring your small quantities of stuff
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, simple and easy to read LCD, have used it on all my medical purchases, to verify count.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Buck

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact and works just as it should and ...
customer_reviews.text: Small and compact and works just as it should and the tare weight helps to keep and eye on its performance
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: I order supplements in bulk so this scale was just what I needed. It's been very accurate especially when I needed to measure .001 mg of pure biotin. Great product and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, extra fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: I got this package overnight without ordering overnight shipping. Great product. Does exactly what it's supposed to do. The little metal tray it comes with is kinda cheap looking, and is pretty small. It looks like it was stamped out of sheet metal. Same with the tweezers. The scale itself is very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: I use this scale to measure grains of gunpowder when I reload my ammunition. I believe that this scale is accurate but it feels like a $10 product and I'm not sure how many miles I'm going to get out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I bought it to weigh supplements. Melatonin in particular. It's been a good buy so far. For a great price!
customer_reviews.author: spencer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate to .0002 oz, not .0001 oz.
customer_reviews.text: I really needed this to be accurate to .0001 oz as advertised, but it got me pretty close to where I needed with it’s .0002 oz accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Good for small scale home use
customer_reviews.text: Could be more accurate but for the price it's good. I use it for measuring nootropics and it works well for that. Again, could be better but it's not expensive lab equipment we're dealing with here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought the batteries it came with were bad, so I changed them out
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item over three months ago, but didn't get to actually use it until I unpacked my studio and got back to work (I just moved). Today I pulled it out to weigh silver and it didn't work. I thought the batteries it came with were bad, so I changed them out... twice. Still doesn't work. Of course, its too late now to return and ask for a replacement. I'm a bit dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Cannatella

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, very nice and practical for weighing supplements. Bad part is that it turns off rather quickly by itself if the weight isnt changing and its hard to clean under the actual scale part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Works Very Well.
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the product. It seems to be constructed very nicely and comes in a storage box. It works well. I use it to measure my supplements in powder form. A great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little scale. Have been using it for at least a year (I think).
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: This is great! I use this to weigh out my own ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I use this to weigh out my own bulk vitamin powders. That way I only take what I think I need, plus I have knowledge of the suppliers. In order to get a .000 windproof scale, ( wind or breath will make a difference to the weight). Would have cost $100's. for a bulky laboratory scale. Who has the counter space for that?
customer_reviews.author: Farrah White

customer_reviews.title: it never worked
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use it for three days and gave up. Every time I turned it on, I had to recalibrate it before it could function. Once it did function, I would weigh the 10g calibration weight and would get wildly fluctuating measurements: 11.75, 9.67... Completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Francois R Velde

customer_reviews.title: This scale does the job!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scale for its size. It’s accurate and it’s easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: EA

product_meta.title: Smart Weigh GEM20 High Precision Digital Milligram Scale 20 x 0.001g Reloading, Jewelry and Gems Scale
product_meta.description:
Precision does not get any more precise with this scale!

The Smart Weigh Digital Pocket Scale is not only compact and convenient but works like a charm. Combines high precision with the ultimate in convenience. Features a flip open cover to protect the weighing platform.

We got you covered!

The scale features multiple measurement modes which will surely meet your needs. Includes: g / oz / ct / ozt / dwt / gn and measures up to 20 grams in increments of 0.001 grams.

On the go!

Carry it with you wherever you go and won’t take up too much space. It is sleek, compact, and lightweight. The convenient tare function allows you get the net weight of a product you are weighing.
feature_bullets: MULTIFUNCTIONAL- Scale is able to weigh in various measurements, making it perfect for all your weighing needs! Weighs in g, oz., ct., ozt., dwt and gn. Whether you are weighing gold, powder, medication or anything for cooking this scale has the right measurements for you!

TARE FUNCTION- Scale comes with a tare function for items that are difficult to weigh and need to be placed in a container or on one of the weighing pans. Place your container or pan on the scale, press the tare function and then put your items in the container/pan

ACCURATE- Utilizes high precision sensor system to get an accurate reading every time! This scale has a thousandth of a gram accuracy (0.001g) so it is extremely precise. This accuracy takes the guesswork out of measuring finer items, so you can just place the items on the scale and know that your reading is the most accurate it can be with this top of the line scale!

CALIBRATION WEIGHTS INCLUDED â€“ Although your Smart Weigh scale will arrive calibrated, we have included two Smart weigh 10g calibration weights. Should you notice any inaccuracies in your scale throughout your time using it, simply use these weights and follow the directions to re-calibrate it so you can continue to use your scale accurately.
CUSTOMER SERVICE â€“ All Smart Weigh scales are individually tested and can be replaced up to two years after purchase, should your product prove defective.
